primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: An intensive basic course in spoken and written Portuguese for students who have no knowledge of this language or advanced Spanish. It aims to give students a basic knowledge of reading, listening, spoken and written skills in a dynamic and communicative way. Presentation of cultural aspects of the Portuguese-speaking world.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese for Beginners
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: No previous knowledge of Portuguese or advanced Spanish.
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT110Y1, PRT120Y1, PRT219Y1, PRT220Y1, PRT320Y1, PRT420H1, PRT420Y1

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students MUST enrol in one of the mandatory tutorial sections offered.

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to the Portuguese language for speakers of Spanish. Development of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills with an emphasis on communication, and an overview of basic grammatical structures and building of vocabulary. Presentation of cultural aspects of the Portuguese-speaking world.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese for Spanish Speakers
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Native or advanced knowledge of Spanish (min. SPA320Y1 for non-native speakers of Spanish); no previous knowledge of Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: PRT100Y1, PRT120Y1, PRT220Y1, PRT320Y1, PRT420Y1, PRT420H1, PRT219Y1, PRT219H1

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students MUST enrol in the mandatory tutorial.

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: For students who have had exposure to spoken Portuguese in an informal context (living in a Portuguese speaking country, or in a Portuguese speaking family) but little to no exposure to written Portuguese. Besides reviewing English/Portuguese spelling differences, written and spoken registers of Portuguese, and basic aspects of the grammatical system, the course (1) provides students with the essential understanding of Portuguese grammatical system; (2) builds their vocabulary; and (3) trains them to express themselves formally in both spoken and written Portuguese.
cmCourseInfo.title: Academic Portuguese
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Basic to relatively high ability to speak and understand Portuguese; limited or no formal education in Portuguese.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students MUST enrol in the mandatory tutorial.

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: This course will bring together Portuguese grammar and language skills into a useful and practical framework, in order to develop students' skills to communicate in an accurate, effective, and informed manner within a variety of socio-cultural situations. Besides introducing new grammar topics corresponding to the intermediate level, it also includes a grammar review with extra work on vocabulary acquisition. Focuses on comprehension, development of a greater complexity in students' written and oral productions, and gaining a better understanding of Portuguese-speaking cultures.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate Portuguese

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students MUST enrol in the mandatory tutorial.

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Overview of Portuguese speech sounds (articulation and transcription). The course provides perception and pronunciation training of Portuguese vowels, consonants, stress, intonation, and co-articulation phenomena in connected speech. The main focus will be on European Portuguese and Brazilian Portuguese, but differences between these two and other Portuguese accents will be discussed as well.
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese Pronunciation

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: A survey of historical and cultural trends in the Portuguese-speaking world, from colonial past to the present. (Offered in alternate years; taught in English)
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Lusophone Culture

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to literary studies in Portuguese and information literacy. Representative selection of Lusophone prose, poetry, and drama, with a focus on critical terminology and methods of literary analysis. Required for a program degree.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Lusophone Literature

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: This course covers aesthetic, cultural, and social aspects of contemporary Brazilian cinema. The course examines both works of fiction and documentaries from emerging voices as well as world renowned filmmakers, spanning from Cinema Novo to the present. Topics include: music and urban culture, violence, inequality, environmental justice, and gender and sexuality. Lecture time is divided between film screening and class discussion held in English. Students choose tutorials in Portuguese (necessary for this course to be considered towards credit in Portuguese programs) or English.
cmCourseInfo.title: Contemporary Brazilian Cinema

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Lectures will be conducted in English and films will be shown with English subtitles.

Students MUST enrol in one of the mandatory tutorial sections offered. TUT0101 will be conducted in Portuguese for students who intend to use this course towards their PRT program credits. TUT0201 will be conducted in English for LAS, CIN, or any other students interested in the subject matter.

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Intensive practice in written and oral Portuguese for the advanced student. Selective review of grammar with emphasis on complex language structures.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Portuguese

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students MUST enroll in the mandatory tutorial section.

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: An overview of the varieties of Portuguese spoken in four continents (Europe, South America, Africa, Asia) and a discussion of the structural similarities and differences between the two most extensively studied varieties: European and Brazilian Portuguese. Analysis of linguistic variation in contemporary Portuguese in terms of phonetics, syntax and lexicon. (Offered in alternate years.)
cmCourseInfo.title: Portuguese Language in the World
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: PRT219Y1 or PRT120Y1 or PRT220Y1 or Permission of the Department

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: A study of advanced aspects of formal Portuguese through reading and extensive writing practice, with an aim at developing skills necessary for academic and professional writing and oral presentations.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Academic Portuguese
